transportAdvice: Bilbao has a clean and efficient metro system, along with trams and buses that connect the city centre and tourist areas well. The riverside old town and Guggenheim district are very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and frequently rainy, typical of the Basque winter; pack waterproofs and expect overcast skies.
Still wet and mild with regular Atlantic showers; one of the rainier months of the year.
Early spring brings slightly warmer days but rain remains frequent; greenery begins to emerge.
Mild and pleasant with a mix of sunny spells and showers; a good time to explore the city on foot.
Comfortable spring weather with longer days; occasional rain but increasingly sunny periods.
Warm and mostly pleasant; some rain is still possible but the city feels lively and inviting.
The warmest and driest month; ideal conditions for sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Warm and relatively dry with long evenings; the city's famous Semana Grande festival takes place this month.
Early autumn is mild and pleasant with a gradual return of Atlantic rain; still a comfortable time to visit.
Noticeably wetter as autumn sets in; mild temperatures but expect regular rainfall.
Cool and rainy with shorter days; the city is quieter and a good time for museum-focused visits.
Cold and wet with festive atmosphere in the city centre; waterproof gear is essential.
